name: places/ChIJVaUYg4dZwokRqu69m2V8ffQ
formattedAddress: 297 Grand St 2nd Floor (2B, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 297 Grand St 2nd Floor (2B, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
Usually if I have a bad experience at a business I move on but I just left my massage and it was one of the most horrible experiences I’ve ever had.

I booked the massage as a birthday gift to myself and after many recommendations to see Charlie from a friend and reviews.

THE WHOLE TIME Charlie kept answering his phone, on speaker, while I was trying to relax and focus on my massage. His phone was also left on the massage table so I would hear it vibrate as the calls came. This happened at least several times within 45 min to which I had to tell Charlie I can’t proceed with this massage anymore. I even said is this normally how his massages go? To which he just laughed and brushed it off.

I’m generally confused why people would enjoy this as I felt unattended to, disrupted, and anything BUT relaxed or calm or even got a decent massage because of the constant influx of calls and being put on pause every 5-10 minutes.

After deciding to cut things short I was pushed and rushed out as if I was the person doing something wrong in the situation. Charlie then pointed to a sign on the door saying this is how he conducts business to which I was still processing what JUST happened and people looking at me to what happened.

I’m shocked, confused, and slightly traumatized by this whole experience.

originalText.text:
i was recommended to come here by my acupuncturist when i developed sciatica. the doctors there are specialists. they're trained in an uncommon diagnosis and therapy that my body responds to.

this is not a normal massage treatment. admittedly, it’s not for everybody. there is no request to “do it softer” here. a huge man grinds his elbow on every part of your body. communication can be difficult (language barrier). the actual space is not attractive although it's not necessary. by design, the treatments are eventually excruciating AND - & i FULLY trust them with my most precious possession - my body. the doctors were able to transform my body to a state where i was able to heal MYSELF and i could walk normally again. (soon after, i even returned to my elite martial arts training!).

at the apex of my original sciatica onset, i was coming to grand nature as often as i could afford to. after several visits of only working muscles, tendons, fascia along meridian pathways - Kavin, who’s been my only dr there - was able to diagnose the injury that was pinching my nerve so severely. by slowly working the vertebrae with his elbow, Kavin pushed it back into place & corrected my spine issue which preceded a cascade of symptoms melting away over time.

i’m a flexible, strong & healthy man that had had months of spasms in my back, hips & glutes without a break. & i’ve been seeing chiropractors since i was a kid - i know that my muscles were so tight that no chiropractor could’ve done that move. at first, i was sure he’d injured me further(!), but a half hour later, i walked out on my feet & slowly improved after that day with regular PT & fanatical core stretching. i still go there as often as i can afford.

it’s with DEEP gratitude & a HUMBLE, humble bow that i recommend my doctor Kavin at grand nature to you for body pain.

originalText.text: This place is amazing! Charlie gives great hard massages, so please be ready for it to hurt but it is a good kind of hurt. I work out six days a week and he really helps me stay mobile! They also offer tea while you wait!

originalText.text:
Don’t tell anyone about this please please haha
No it’s not the place for relaxing massage. No it’s not a spa. Here you coming to heal. It’s gonna be painful, yes you will pay cash and leave tips(thank you tho to stop demanding 20%)
I can live without this place. I have pain in back- I am coming here.
Guys help me a lot for last 4 years.
If I wanna go to relax, it’s not the right place.

originalText.text: There's a few massage places clustered together here, but this one is THE BEST. The guys working here are so friendly, greeting you as you walk in. You can make appointments or walk up - haven't had to wait yet. I have been seeing a guy David here - incredibly firm, but what I need to have therapeutic impact. They go hard and you'll wince at times, but afterwords you feel like a new person. I always have difficulty finding massages that are "deep" or firm enough - that was definitely not lacking here. $28 for a half hour. Ten time punch card promo, so if you go 10 times you get a free massage. They ask you your problem areas and then attack the problem, never slowing or tiring.
